cspom
Class CSPOM

java.lang.Object
  cspom.CSPOM

public final class CSPOM
extends java.lang.Object

Problem is the central class of the Constraint Satisfaction Problem Object Model. You can create a problem from scratch by instantiating this class and then using the addConstraint and addVariable classes. Most usually, the Problem.load method is used in order to create a Problem object from a file.

The Problem class adheres to the following definition : A CSP is defined as a pair (X, C), X being a finite set of variables, and C a finite set of constraints. A domain, that is a finite set of values is associated to each variable x in X. Each constraint involves a finite set of variables (its scope) and defines a set of allowed and forbidden instantiations of these variables.

Author:
Julien Vion
See Also:
CSPOMConstraint, CSPOMVariable
